column4: i'm trying to install ndiswrapper, and i have an amd-64 kernel, but that kernel doesn't have a linux-source-(version) package in the repository, do i need to switch to a different kernel and then do the patch?
you can't, to the best of my knowledge, run 32-bit ndis drivers with ndiswrapper on amd64
ok then
you shouldn't have to
what do you mean?
I mean that the base ubuntu kernel contains the usual dvb modules
look here: http://www.ubuntulinux.org/wiki/NovaTHowTo/
interesting; Nova-T USB works fine with my default Ubuntu kernel
in Warty, though, I have to manually load tda1004x (doesn't autoload) and create the device nodes, but neither really requires kernel patching
where do you get that file?
for kernels >=2.6.10 there's a script in Documentation/dvb
for earlier kernels you need an earlier version of the firmware; I can send it if you need it
hmm, except it would seem that the USB model might use a different frontend driver than your thing
mine uses a tda10046, while the instructions there in the howto imply that CX22700 is used for the PCI card
that's right, i checked
so, it might be that the card doesn't work out of the box (or it might not)... :/
, assuming it does, do i just need to install mplayer and go?
I'd try upgrading to Hoary before starting manual patching, but your call
, i have hoary, but i'm a total n00b

ok; well, then it (basically) should work like that (except I use xine), _if_ your card doesn't need a firmware file. If it does, you'll need to get that. Get the kernel sources and see Documentation/dvb
linux-source-2.6.10 or something
thanks, i'm onto it
(and then there's the possible autodetection problems, but on Hoary my devices at least autodetects just fine)
